title: Great Old One Patron

effects: Choose one creature you can see within 30 feet; you and the creature can communicate telepathically while within a number of miles of each other equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1 mile).
You must each know a language the other knows to understand each other.
The connection lasts for a number of minutes equal to your Warlock level and ends early if you connect with a different creature.
You always have the spells in the Great Old One Spells table prepared at the warlock levels shown.
When you cast a warlock spell that deals damage, you can change its damage type to Psychic.
When you cast a warlock spell that is an enchantment or illusion, you can do so without verbal or somatic components.

feature_defs.trigger: when you form a telepathic bond with a creature using Awakened Mind
effects: You can force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC.
On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you and you have advantage on attack rolls against it for the duration of the bond.
limits: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest unless you expend a Pact Magic spell slot (no action required) to restore its use.

effects: When you cast Hex and choose an ability, the target also has disadvantage on saving throws of the chosen ability for the duration of the spell.
Your thoughts can’t be read by telepathy or other means unless you allow it.
You have resistance to psychic damage, and whenever a creature deals psychic damage to you, that creature takes the same amount of damage that you take.
You can cast it without concentration; if you do, its duration becomes 1 minute for that casting.
The summoned aberration gains temporary hit points equal to your Warlock level + your Charisma modifier.
The first time each turn the aberration hits a creature under your Hex, it deals extra psychic damage equal to Hex’s bonus damage.
